post: Meet Sellers Shockley, our K-8 Content Intern! Sellers is excited to join the Bill of Rights Institute as a intern for the summer. Attending the University of Mississippi and studying Elementary Education and Public Policy Leadership, Sellers is excited to learn and support the K-8 content team in their quest to teach civics and provide resources to teachers and students across the country.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #internship

At the Bill of Rights Institute, we are proud to partner with organizations and companies that support civic educationand Federal Flags, LLC wants to give back to the same cause you support. Interested in purchasing an all-American-made flag before Independence Day? Just make a purchase through Federal Flags using the code 'BRI,' and Federal Flags will donate a portion of each sale to support the Bill of Rights Institute and civic education. Plus, when you use the code 'BRI' at checkout, you will enjoy an additional 5% off on any already-discounted Federal Flags product. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eFFbmjbM.  #billofrightsinstitute  #bri  #americanflag  #july4th

Congratulations to Grace Liu, the MyImpact Challenge Second Prize Winner from Syosset High School in Syosset, NY! Grace founded Research to Empower, which provides free research training to underrepresented populations. Curious to know more about Grace's inspiring project? Read more about her journey and the impact she's making in our community here  https://lnkd.in/e7XhCrxR  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Through our Power of the Printed Word campaign, we are working to make pocket constitutions available to teachers and students nationwide. Printing and finishing companies from across America have rallied to help, and have begun donating their services to this great cause. Watch Bill of Rights Institute Director, Corporate Relations Justin Goldstein talk with Kelly Mallozzi, Principal of Success. In. Print, about the campaign and how companies can help put Americas Founding documents in teachers and students hands.  https://lnkd.in/eNSDjhDs Interested in supporting the Power of the Printed Word? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eE-zWeup  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #poweroftheprintedword

Congratulations to Sebastian Tan, the MyImpact Challenge First Prize Winner from Sewickley Academy in Sewickley, PA! Sebastian's service project, OutsideConnection, supports previously incarcerated individuals reentering society through a specialized job-listing platform. Are you curious to know more about Sebastian's inspiring project? Read more about his journey and the impact he's making here https://lnkd.in/e7XhCrxR.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Congratulations to Anna Kunkel, the MyImpact Challenge Grand Prize Winner from the Seven Hills School in Cincinnati, OH! Anna's Student Alliance for Immigrants and Refugees (SAIR) service project helps immigrants and refugees in Cincinnati with English education through initiatives like welcome letters, baskets, and writing contests. Curious to know more about Anna's inspiring project? Read more about her journey and the impact she's making in our community here,  https://lnkd.in/e9qHaPtN.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Help us find the Bill of Rights Institute National Civics Teacher of the Year! Do you know a civics teacher who is making a real difference in the classroom? Who goes the extra mile to help students learn about our country, government, and Founding principles? You could help us find our Bill of Rights Institute National Civics Teacher of the Year! The National Civics Teacher of the Year will earn national recognition and a $5,000 prize. Educators, students, parents, and community members can submit nominations right on our website:  https://lnkd.in/eeyPqeMM  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #NationalCivicsTeacheroftheYear

Utah students had the opportunity to hear from top-notch speakers, showcase their civic engagement skills, and compete for $5,000 in prizes at the Utah MyImpact Challenge Youth Leadership Workshop. MyImpact Challenge is a national contest hosted by the Bill of Rights Institute where students develop constitutionally-principled civic engagement projects. Hosted on June 14 at the Utah Valley University campus in Orem, the Utah MyImpact Challenge Youth Leadership Workshop represented a collaboration among the Bill of Rights Institute, the Center for Constitutional Studies at Utah Valley University, the Utah Civic Learning Collaborative, and Youthlinc. Students participated in a day of civic education and leadership programming, and had an opportunity to demonstrate their MyImpact Challenge projects. To learn more, visit  https://lnkd.in/eQ6ZP_aF  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge
